description: Hackney was home to two of Britain’s greatest-ever dramatists – Harold Pinter (1930-2008) and Arnold Wesker (1932-2016). Both working-class, both Jewish, both world-famous. Led by Hackney experts, Laurie Elks and Julia Lafferty.

factsheet.heading: Description
paragraphs: The walk visits sites integral to the life of two London dramatic geniuses. Pinter was a Nobel Prize-winner and Wesker was knighted.

Pinter and Wesker  are united in being foremost members of the diverse group of playwrights – “Angry Young Men” – who emerged in the late 1950s to react (in very individual ways) against stale middle class drawing room drama which formed the staple of British theatre.
Wesker married a working class girl.  Pinter married an actress, Vivien Merchant and then – from 1974 - the famed historian and daughter of a peer, Lady Antonia Fraser.

Pinter was famous and celebrated throughout his career.  Wesker, after initial celebrity, fulminated in obscurity – an “Angry Old Man” – before being “rediscovered” towards the end of his life.  Discover these different lives.

name: Pinter/Wesker Memories Walk
